questions.question_text:
You are piloting Microsoft Teams in a network environment.
You need to test the environment to ensure that VPN users are configured correctly for split tunneling.
What should you use?
questions.answer_description:
Microsoft 365 Network Connectivity Test Results includes a VPN Split Tunnel section:
Each Optimize category route for Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, and Microsoft Teams is tested to see if It's tunneled on the VPN. A split out workload avoids the VPN entirely. A tunneled workload is sent over the VPN. A selective tunneled workload has some routes sent over the VPN and some split out. A passing result will show if all workloads are split out or selective tunneled.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/office-365-network-mac-perf-onboarding-tool?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
You create a network region Region1 in Microsoft Teams.
You are adding a network site to Region1. The site has a 1.5-Mb connection.
You need to ensure that all users at the site have a good voice experience.
What should you do?

choices.A: Create and assign a Teams Network Roaming Policy that has IP video disabled.
choices.B: Assign the Region1 users a meeting policy that has a media bit rate of 1,500 Kbs.
choices.C: Run the Microsoft 365 network connectivity test tool.
choices.D: Create and assign a Teams Network Roaming Policy that has a media bit rate of 500 Kbs.

discussion.content: Correct answer is either A or D.. Network Roaming Policy can be granted to a site rather than a user. so users need to have the policy applied while they are in that specific site, not everywhere they go.

Selected Answer: A
Site bandwidth is too low to handle even 10 concurrent video calls (150 kbps * 10), so disabling video will ensure 25 audio calls go on successfully.

Selected Answer: A
Same question as previous page, the question clearly states all users at the site have a good voice experience. So the answer remains the same A.

Selected Answer: A
The TeamsNetworkRoamingPolicy cannot be granted to a user but instead can be assigned to a network site. The settings from the TeamsMeetingPolicy included are AllowIPVideo and MediaBitRateKb.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Answer is A

Selected Answer: B
I'd say B:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/prepare-network

Answer B. 
Dont make assumptions regarding video it needs to stay ON unless you are told otherwise
Duplicated question with Topic 2 Question 3 where good answer was B

questions.question_text:
You are adding new sites to your company.
The reporting team needs location-based reports in Microsoft Power BI that include the subnet information of the new sites.
You need to add the information to Microsoft Teams.
What should you do?

choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, define a network subnet.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, define a network topology.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard, upload tenant data.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, add the subnets to the Network planner.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company is migrating from a legacy PBX system to Microsoft Teams.
The phone number range is + 1-423-555-1xxx. The PBX system uses four-digit dialing internally. Extensions are the last four digits of the number.
You need to ensure that you can use four-digit dialing for your numbers in Teams. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
How should you configure the normalization rule? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: +14235551\d{3}
Need to string away + 1-423-555-1, and keep only 3 digits.
Example:
New-CsTeamsTranslationRule -Identity 'AddPlus1' -Pattern '^(\d{10})$' -Translation '+1$1'
This example creates a rule that strips +1 from any E.164 eleven digits number. For example, +12065555555 will be translated to 206555555
Example 2:
New-CsTeamsTranslationRule -Identity 'StripE164SeattleAreaCode' -Pattern '^\+1206555(\d{4})$' -Translation '$1'
This example creates a rule that strips +1206555 from any E.164 ten digits number. For example, +12065555555 will be translated to 5555

Box 2: +1423555$1 -
Keep the 3 digits. Add one digit with the translation.
Teams phone pattern translation example
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/new-csteamstranslationrule

discussion.content:
Should be:
Pattern: ^(1\d{3})$
The pattern means: Starting with '1' followed by any number, matching it 3 times.
Translation: +1423555$1
The Translation means: If the pattern is true or a match, replace it with +1423555 and the value inside the 1st captured group (1\d{3}) = (all characters captured inside this parenthesis)
Exactly. Pattern should be Pattern: ^(1\d{3})$
Pattern should be Pattern: ^(1\d{3})$

comments.content: Agreed. In https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-voice-routing it clearly states: "while the voice route is assigned priorities, the SBCs in the routes are tried in random order". To have calls failover from SBC1 to SBC2 you would need additional configuration (which could be via PSTN usages as you noted; using the -failoverresponsecodes switch could also be in use). With the absence of add'l information I agree that SBC1 is the best answer for the first, and we assume the failover requirement is covered with add'l configuration. As you say, not a great question.

discussion.content:
I think the answer should be:
SBC1
SBC2
SBC2 and SBC3
By having SBC1 and SBC2 in the same route for the Redmond calls, SBC1 and SBC2 will be tried in a random order - requirement is for SBC1 to always be tried first. If you have just SBC1 in the Redmond route, then it will try the US&Canada route if SBC1 is failed so long as there is a PSTN usage defined with both Redmond and US&Canada routes in the same usage. 
Not a great question because we don't know what the PSTN usages look like...

comments.content: Agree, nº1 is sbc1 and sbc2, you need to indicate both sbc for calls fail over

discussion.content:
1. SBC1 and SBC2
2. SBC2
3.SBC2 and SBC3
Reference
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-trunk-failover-on-outbound-call
In the following diagram, when a user makes a call to a phone number, there are two SBCs in the route that can potentially deliver this call. Initially, SBC1.contoso.com is selected for the call, but SBC1.contoso.com isn't able to reach a PTSN network due to a network issue. By default, the call will be completed at this moment.

Diagram showing SBC unable to reach PSTN due to network issue.

But there is one more SBC in the route which potentially can deliver the call. If you configure the parameter Set-CSOnlinePSTNGateway -Identity sbc1.contoso.com -FailoverResponseCodes "408", the second SBC will be tried-- SBC2.contoso.com in the following diagram:

SBC1
SBC2
SBC2 and SBC3

SBC1, SBC2, SBC 2 and 3 ("In both examples, while the voice route is assigned priorities, the SBCs in the routes are tried in random order.") https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-voice-routing

Hi all, sbc1 and sbc2 for route1 is not correct. Because "If two (or more) SBCs in one route are considered healthy and equal, Fisher-Yates shuffle is applied to distribute the calls between the SBCs."

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-monitor-and-troubleshoot.

comments.content: The problem is the cmdlet don't have the 'Priority' parameter

discussion.content:
it is SBC1 > SBC2 and then SBC2 & 3

all SBC's 
listed in a voice route will be tried in a round robin - that's a basic rule of voice routing

Answer should be
SBC1
SBC2
SBC2 and SBC3

If Dialed number is with Redmond NPA number, it shall choose SBA1
If SBA1 fails, Calls to Redmond NPA shall take the second route and go through SBA2 since the dialed number is still national number, which start with +1.
If it is any other NPA code, call shall take second route and send to SBC2
For any international calls (which does not start with +1) , SBC2 or SBC3 shall be selected randomly. Hence all conditions are satisfied.

Three voice routes, three priorities. Voice Route 1 Priority 1 SBC1, VR2 PRI2 SBC2, VR3 PRI3 SBC2 SBC3. failover will take place if more than one voice route exist and failover from the top priority to the lowest one.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-trunk-failover-on-outbound-call
Based on this the answer provided is correct.( there is the failover config required)
SBC1 and SBC2
SBC2
SBC2 and SBC3 .

comments.content:
No need to be listed in the same route, you only need to define that SBC1 in the "Redmond" policy should use Priority 1. By best practice you would create a new route called "Redmond2" and define there the SBC2 as a Priority 2 GW and then you have your failover route.
Ref: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-voice-routing
So I agree with Stove1 but the issue description and the solutions are very poorly described in this question.

discussion.content: I would stay with answer. for failover both SBC's need to be listed so SBC1,SBC2 ; SBC2 ; SBC2 and SBC 3. I understand if 2 SBC's are listed it uses round robin or Pseudo Random Selection But If SBC 2 isn't listed in the top answer, and SBc1 is not available, it will fail.
I also think the same as Stove1

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Your company has offices in Seattle.
You deploy Microsoft Teams Phone. You have three Session Border Controller (SBCs) named SBC1, SBC2, and SBC3.
You need to configure voice routing to meet the following requirements:
✑ All calls to area codes 425 and 206 must attempt to go to SBC1, and if SBC1 is unavailable, fail over to SBC2.
✑ All other calls to the United States and Canada must go out through SBC2.
✑ International calls must go out through SBC2 or SBC3.
How should you complete the PowerShell script? To answer, drag the appropriate values to the correct targets. Each value may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
